chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Vance Marion Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vance Marion Watson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vance Marion Watson was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vance Marion Watson

records.addlTxt: Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing Held on June 10th, 2022

2:30 PM Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Vance Marion Watson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recommends 5 years prison fashioned as 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision with credit for 146 days. Pay a $250 fine plus costs. State has complied with Victim's Rights. State gives argument of recommendation. State reviews 15 prior convictions. Attorney Craker addresses credit as of today and eligibility for both prison programs. Attorney Craker requests 5 years prison fashioned as 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 3 years probation. Reviews giving defendant a chance at being a productive member of society as a young adult. States defendant has drug and alcohol addictions. Attorney Craker notes defendant has been accepted into Drug Court in St. Louis County. Notes he was on probation supervision at the time of this offense. 
Court reviews defendant's criminal history. Court reviews the factors in determining sentence. Court orders 5 years prison fashioned as 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. Credit of 146 days. Pay a fine of $250 plus mandatory court costs and pay outstanding financial obligations. Eligible for both prison programs.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:27 AM Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Vance Marion Watson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Defendant will plead to Count 1. PSI asked for and schedule sentencing hearing. State agrees. Will cap argument at 5 years, 250 fine plus costs. 
Court recounts charges to Defendant. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by his plea. Court finds defendant understands rights he is waiving and waiver is freely, voluntarily and knowingly made. Court accepts defendant's plea and finds plea is freely, voluntarily and knowingly made. Court finds defendant guilty. No objection to factual basis. Court 2 is dismissed.
Court orders PSI report. Sets sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Vance Marion Watson. 
State- made offer 2 months ago
Att Craker- Requests plea hearing next week
Court sets date
Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:17 AM Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Vance Marion Watson in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Craker requests another status as she hasn't had a chance to speak to defendant. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:08 AM Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Vance Marion Watson in custody.  Chad Lalor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Craker received information, not guilty pleas, requests status.
Court sets date
  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:15 AM Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Vance Marion Watson in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Craker makes argument, filed written motion. Client has been accepted into drug court in St Louis County. Has a pending matter in MN. Also one prior conviction.
State- no warrant in MN for missing court. Opposes modification. Prior conviction was sentenced on 11/09/21. New case was for offense on 11/28/21. This case is for offense in January this year. No ties to Douglas County
Att Craker- has family in Douglas County. Hasn't missed court. 
Court- Defendant is 18, already sentenced to prison imposed and stayed. Has second felony allegation from MN and a felony allegation here. Doesn't believe $1000 cash is unreasonable. Motion is denied.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Atty Hoffman-Client will waive the preliminary heairng this morning;   Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with  victim 1 or their residence.   No use or possession of alcohol.

03:28 PM Defendant Vance Marion Watson in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Vance Marion Watson in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Plead not guilty on Count 2 set for Preliminary on Count 1. Defendant pleads to Court on getting signature bond instead of cash bond. Defendant indicates he is out on a $30,000 signature bond and has Court tomorrow. Court offers breakout room for Counsel and Defendant to speak with one another. Atty Craker indicates can address bond as it comes up.   States request on bail: $2500 cash no contact with victim 1 or that address, No use or possession of alcohol. State gives prior criminal history. Defendant is currently out on bond with felony charges and on bond in Duluth, MN.  
Atty asks for signature bond. Atty indicates defendant has never missed any hearing dates. Defendant is still local even though he has a MN address and he does have family locally. He does have a Court appearance in Duluth tomorrow and does not want to miss that appearance as he has no missed Court appearances. Defendant can get work through the work agency. Defendant is unable to post any cash bail.
Court does have concerns that  he has a pending en banc, $30,000 signature bond with 41 months prison.  Defendant does have 3 other felonies over him with serious bond and serious charges pending. 
Defendant pleads to Court to give signature bond. Defendant does have a job in Montcello. Defendant does not have help from anyone and will be stuck here. Does understand the importance of attending Court. Defendant understands the signature bond release. 
Court goes over criminal history with Defendant. Court Orders $1000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 as listed in the ID Key or their residence No use or possession of alcohol.
Atty asserts defendant does quailfy. Court acknowledges text message reminders slip.
 Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
